Reviews.Title: A Canon Killer, An incredible Camera
Reviews.Author: C. A. Bayko "Roadwarrior"
Reviews.Content: Many years ago I did quite a bit of photography; and so I know what it takes to get a great photo.  Unfortunately the digital cameras, particularly the small ones, have been hampered by slow ability to capture light, and thus get clear pictures in Low light without a flash, or get great shots at High Speeds.  Also the digital camera's ability to distinguish between a strong backlight, faces, a variety of scenes, like bright sun, shade, cloudy days, indoor light, has been poor, but gradually getting better across the last 4 years.  This Nikon S620, solves all of those problems.  All of these situations are corrected in this camera automatically if you want to just point and shoot.  It is a master of computer engineering.  For several years now with most of the strong brands, you could get good pictures in all the above situations, by correcting for red eye, selecting special scenes, and using tripods in low light.  What I wanted to see if, with this Nikon, IF you set it to complete auto, you could get great pictures.  Has the computer advanced far enough, where it could anticipate all these situations and give you a great picture?  Answer is a resounding yes.  I have tested this for a month, and I love it so much; I have now bought one for one of my daughters.  This model as some professional reviews have said is a bit more practical for everyday situations, because of the wide angle.  What it lacks in the Zoom, though the S630 is tempting; it makes up in speed, to handle all the above situations well.  The controls are easy to operate.  The high Megapixel count let you crop photos closer and still have a great picture; like the one I uploaded with the bird nesting.  The anti-shake /vibration works well; to give you almost always clear shots, in these difficult situations.UPDATE MAY 7th. : I looked at the S630 Product page and noticed 6 reviews, all but one positive. The one negative review, talks about noise in pictures and poor performance in low light. The speed rating of the 620 is much higher than the 630, at native resolution; thus resulting in sharper pictures in the extremes of photography, low light and high speed. I belive by my own photo's the 620 is a remarkable advancement in giving excellent pictures acorss the range. I am not saying, to not buy the 630; only that the powerful zoom in such a small camera is not without compromise. Thus there may be issues with that camera when used as an all around camera. If you are looking for an excellent all around camera; the Nikon S620 is THE one to buy!

Reviews.Title: Tiny, powerful and fast.
Reviews.Author: Mark Dalzell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this S620 as a replacement for my aging and failing Coolpix S51. I was looking for something faster and smaller and this camera is definitely both of those things. It was a tough decision between this and the S630.. which has a slightly higher resolution and a 7x zoom, but I decided that the speed more than makes up for it. The advertised .7 second startup time is pretty much right on... power button press to first image recorded is a little less than 2 seconds, and it can take 2 pictures in about 3 seconds in single mode. This varies a bit depending on light, subject and which extra features that you have on.  The smile detector and blink proof are nifty toys, but I don't really care and I leave them off. It's true that it takes about 3 seconds to load up the zoom and other features, but if you just need to power up fast to catch an unexpected shot, then 2 seconds is all it takes. The pictures it takes are very sharp and the colors are vibrant, and the macro works great down to less than 1". It takes pretty clear pictures in nearly pitch black, automatically adjusting to ISO 1600. I tried setting it to ISO 6400 to see what would happen but the resulting picture was mostly useless. It must be for high speed action rather than low light applications. As for negatives, my biggest would be that the metering options are limited. The 2 choices are Matrix and Center Weighted, but the Center Weighted is all over the place. On my old S51 if you told it center, then it focused on whatever was in the center no matter what. The center weighting on the S620 tries to guess what you were aiming for somewhere near the center, and it's often not right.... so you have to keep trying until it figures out what you want. The other negative was already mentioned by another reviewer, and that's that Nikon uses a non-standard USB cable. I usually pull the card out to save battery power when I'm transferring pictures, but it's worth noting for other potential purchasers.As a side note, I purchased this from J&R;, and when it arrived it was the kit version, which included the Nikon 5811 leather case - so I'm glad I didn't spend the extra $18 on that... before you buy the case separately, check with the retailer to see if it's included.** Update ** Okay - it's been a few weeks, a few thousand miles and 1000 or so pictures and I have one negative to add to my review. The camera boots up and shoots instantly and takes a few seconds to load up everything else, which is already known. What I discovered is that between about 2 and 4 seconds after the camera is turned on it won't do anything at all. So 0-2 seconds = take a picture, 2-4 seconds = miss your shot, 4+ seconds = full power. I tend to turn my camera off and was relying on the instant startup, but I had to plan accordingly if something was coming in 3 seconds that I wanted a shot of... :)Otherwise, the camera has worked perfectly in every other respect so far.[...]

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but has a few caveats...
Reviews.Author: M. Paisner
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great Flash, Three inch LCD, Easy ControlsCons: Made in China, Long time to take picture, PROPRIETARY USB CABLEBest Uses: Point and shoot, Flash shotsI just got back from two weeks in Australia and bought this a couple days before I left for my point and shoot as an adjunct to my Nikon D200 DSLR.I got flash shots the wimpy flash on my D200 wouldn't get.Startup time is a bit too long for me. Time between shots is great.I didn't take the manual figuring if I needed it, I'd download it. I didn't need it. Controls are intuitive although it takes getting used to the rotary control. HOWEVER, the flash is fast and easy to shut off (or change settings) and that's a big plus over my old Canon.On the negative side, this baby takes a long time to take the photo. It's about 2 seconds. It must be doing all the face searching and focusing, etc., but I had to learn to hold the button down until it went through it's gyrations, and that's a long time.MOST ANNOYINGLY: I went to download the pictures at the end of the first day in Australia only to find it doesn't use a standard USB cable. I left the proprietary cable at home because I carry one standard USB cable. I didn't have a card reader with me (I have about 3 at home) and they were very expensive in Austalia. So I waited until I got back to download and backup my photos. With my girlfriend's Canon point and shoot and my D200, I downloaded the photos each night to my Macintosh laptop, then copied the full sized photos to my iPod. That way, there were 3 copies. And I never keep the 3 devices in the same place.I'd give this camera 4 stars with faster shoot times and 5 stars for a standard USB cable interface.Lastly, I would never take the advice of "get a large memory card." Get several 2Gb cards and rotate them. This way, if you lose a card or the camera gets stolen, you don't have all your vacation photos in one place. This tip was given to me by a pro photog friend.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Fast, Excellent Pictures
Reviews.Author: JaysJob "Jay"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I also bought it to replace an aging digital (Kodak). I did a lot of research because for me $300+ is a lot of money.  For my purposes, which is home inspection pictures, I could not be more pleased!It is THE fastest starting, compact digital point and shoot out camera out there right now. The speed of startup is very important to me. The old camera took about 7+ secs. to start. This one is about 1.5 like others have said but, not all the functions are available for another second or so depending on which features you have enabled. It shuts off just as fast. I turn the camera on and off a lot and it adds up over the course of a day.The other nice thing about this camera is that it is almost a pro-sumer camera. It's a great blend of a high end digital SLR features and the ease of point and shoot. I know it's not a $2,000 SLR so pros please don't blast me. What I mean is that it takes excellent photos in a wide range of situations, automatically. Auto is the setting I use most because, unlike a lot of other cameras, other Coolpix included, it does do what it is supposed to do. Odd huh? Funny when that is the exception instead of the norm.That said, it is easy enough to use right away and has list of features deep enough for anyone wanting to manually set any or all the the controls manually. There is an automatic setting, the one I use most of the time, which is like any other auto setting people are used to but, there is also an *automatic* SCENE setting. So it's not just inside vs outside or flash vs no flash. No guessing or fiddling with "Is this a sport shot or a back lit situation?". That will change to the best scene mode available, automatically. It's all the cool features I was ever promised on other cameras, delivered.It also has an automatic lens cover which is awesome. My other one was always clanging around one way or another. Putting it on or taking it off sometimes I would accidentally touch the front of the lens and it drove me nuts!The stabilization is also very good. I shake a lot when taking photos and this camera has two stabilization methods. You can use one or the other or both or none. Depending on how you set the camera up it, works very well. I used to have to carry a mono pod with me all the time. I now leave it at home.The panorama feature is also one of the best and easiest I have ever used. It overlays the last shot to the next in the LCD as you take the series of photos. It can pan left, right, up or down. Very cool!The only con I can think of is that the LCD screen on the back of the camera is flush with the back of the case, like an iPod, and I am afraid I'll forget and set it down on its back and scratch the screen. I am looking for one of those silicone skin covers to give it a smidgen of inset to prevent this from happening. So no worries there for me.Aside from that one issue the camera is just great and I am very happy with my purchase.Whether you want to take no hassle pictures or dig into all the settings available (which you don't have to) it really is a wonderful camera!There is so much more I could say but you're probably tired of reading by now. :0)PS. After owning the camera for a week I bought a nice Nikon neoprene case fitted just for this camera for $15 at Target that works like a charm!

Reviews.Title: Travel perfect...........
Reviews.Author: P. Skattum
Reviews.Content: I got my Nikon Coolpix two days before leaving for a two week trip to Thailand.  My son-in-law actually advised me to get this camera for it's simplicity and easy to use qualities. As usual,I am always late in getting organized. I ordered the camera from Amazon and thought there would be no way I'd get the camera before I left. It arrived in plenty of time.  I had plenty of time on the plane to 'study' the instructions.  Finally, in Bangkok and ready to shot pictures.I had a blast on the trip and a ball using my new Nikon.  It is so easy to use and takes great pictures.  I have a wonderful pictoral history of my Thailand trip.  I have clear, beautiful pictures of elephants and a cyrstal clear photos of ants marching one by one on top of a ledge.  What fun.  I'm not technical genius when it comes to new gadgets, but this Nikon turned me into a Ansel Adams, in my mind.Come over I'll show you the big elephants and the tiny ants.

Reviews.Title: Portable and fast
Reviews.Author: Bernard Mortel
Reviews.Content: The S620 has a nice portable design and can be ready to photograph in about 1.5 seconds.It will turn on quickly but controls and focusing aren't availabe unit three quarters of a second later.The wide angle 28mm equivalent makes group shots in tight areas easier as well. Lots of fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Travis Gordon
Reviews.Content: Since this is my first digital camera I don't have anything to really  compare the 620 against. I was looking for something relatively small in size that would be easy to use, take great pictures and not be too terribly expensive. The 620 has met and exceeded my expectations. The start up time and picture quality are stand outs for me. I've taken about 50 shots so far with this camera in different situations and I have yet to be disappointed. If your an average user like me who wants to be able to take great pictures right out of the box with minimal adjustments then look no further.PS  I got this camera from JR music through amazon and like the other reviewer said, it was the kit version and it came with the carrying case and the extended warranty. So yes it may be worth your wild to verify what your getting before you order any extras.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bertram M. Berla
Reviews.Content: Very nice little camera, the images of course still look like they're from a compact, but they're better quality than most. The camera does very nicely in low-light situations, and the close-up feature works surprisingly very well.

Reviews.Title: great for low-light close-up photography
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically to get better photographs in low light, close-up conditions because from what I've read it's one of the best point-and-shoots you can get for that.  Both the photo and video quality fulfill my expectations.  It's amazing how fast and how much the technology is improving!Overall, I think this is a great point-and-shoot camera for low-light close-ups.

Reviews.Title: Was not expecting so much!!
Reviews.Author: Eddy De La Rosa
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple camera not too expensive just to have pics of birthday parties and trips. found a deal but this camera is way better thatn i thought for its price. starting with the size...it feels very confortable in the hand and is small.picture quality is incredible for a point and shot digital camera, in 2 days using it i've taken pics that seem like taken with profesional cameras...it works incredibly well in the night with no flash and captures true colors with no flash as well (personaly i dont like using flash)i works good in auto mode you feel like a pro taking pics. havent tried face detection or smile detection that much bec im not interested in those features so much.usd cable is not the standar but i can use the sd cards to my laptop if have no cablethe start is not that fast but is compensated with the quickly shootting..the anti shaking and vibration reduction works fine.in conclusion my only complaint would be with the start time its about 4 seconds, all other features are just the best!! i would recomend this camera !

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Duncan C. Brindley
Reviews.Content: I had a Mediterranean cruise with stops in Rome, Naples (Pompeii),Athens, Ephesus and Egypt coming up and wanted a new, small camera with a wide-angle lens. This Nikon was great. I was hoping to get good photos in a point and shoot that I could fit in my pocket without fear of dropping it. I was not disappointed. The landscape photos are superb. The details were exceptional, even enlarged. You can see the sweat on my brow by the pyramids in the 105 degree heat. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good overall choice, with caveats
Reviews.Author: Brad Felmey
Reviews.Content: In researching what point-and-shoot to purchase, I was swayed by the comments of other reviewers that this camera was very quick to get from powered off to a state where it was ready to shoot. While no slouch, I have not necessarily noticed that it is blazingly faster than my previous weapon of choice, the Fuji Finepix F30. I would estimate the average time at around 5 seconds-ish.While on the subject of speed, the auto-focus I find to be quite speedy. Obviously, the lower the light the more time it needs.Writing to card (in this case a Class 10 SanDisk 8GB) is decent, but could use a smidgen of improvement, especially since I'm using such expensive and high-performance storage media and still find myself waiting a couple of extra seconds to hit the view button.It has exceptional low-light capabilities while holding down graininess to a minimum as long as the subject is not in motion. The color is good, although to be fair I am not a shutterbug and my eyes glaze over as soon as talk turns technical on this point. I just know what I like when I see it, and this gives very good pictures for my taste.The menu system with thumbwheel operation is very much better than the aforementioned Fuji FinePix F-30 (which is just awful, in my opinion). You can generally find what you're looking for pretty quickly and toggle through the available selections.The included Li-ion battery lasts well, but here is where I must register the largest drawback from my personal perspective. You must physically remove the battery and insert it into a rather bulky external AC-fed battery charger. Other cameras of this type have the ability to charge the battery whilst connected via USB. I do not wish to carry around an artificially large collection of plastic and wires to charge the battery. This doesn't work well for carrying in my laptop bag, nor is it desirable for long-distance motorcycle trips, where packing space is at a premium, and AC power isn't guaranteed.I have given this product an overall satisfaction rating of "3". If not for the battery's inability to be recharged via USB (as noted above), my recommendation would have been a very strong "4".

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S620
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader "Nikon Shooter"
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D300 for my serious shooting, but often I just want something for in the pocket--especially when lugging around a DSLR and lenses is just not practical. Highest on my list of musts for a point-and-shoot: image quality, resolution, stabilization, and short lag time. This camera is amazing in all these areas. And it is one of the easiest-to-use cameras you'll ever find. I originally bought this camera for my son and daughter-in-law, but upon testing it out for them, I just had to have one of my own. It's a jewel! Get one of these cameras before they stop manufacturing them!

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Kristina
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures! And the reaction from my grandmother when she opened the gift was incredible. the battery seems to last forever and the computer soft ware is super user friendly.

Reviews.Title: go with the Nikon S610
Reviews.Author: Schat13 "Tammy"
Reviews.Content: I had the Nikon S610, which I loved until it was dropped and broken. I wanted to replace it, but went ahead and read the reviews on the S620 and the S630. The S630 got pretty bad reviews, so I went with the S620. Huge mistake. I, frankly, HATE this camera. I've lost so many photo opportunities - my best friend as he said, "I do" for one - because this camera would not focus because the light was too weak, or too bright, or because the subject wasn't the exact right distance away, or because the wind was blowing in the wrong direction.  The camera simply will NOT focus if the conditions aren't ideal - I would say at least half of the photos I take are blurry because the camera was unable to focus. Simple portraits - a friend standing still in front of a fountain, sun high in the sky - come out blurry. I have NEVER had these types of issues with a camera, especially a Nikon. After owning and loving the S610, buying and attempting to use this camera has been a nightmare. Please, pass on the S620 and buy the S610, an older but FAR SUPERIOR version of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Skip this camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Siron
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to replace a less-than half as expensive one that our two-year-old slammed to the ground in a tantrum. In hindsight, I wish we had re-bought that one.The "Auto" setting is guaranteed to produce blurry, yellow pictures in anything other than incandescent or natural light. If you have good lighting, then you get blurry pictures with vivid color. If you tinker with the manual settings, you can get a picture in non-natural lighting that is nice, but if you forget to change it in other settings, I.E. you're chasing your toddler inside and outside, then it wrecks all your other pictures. This completely defeats both the purpose of "auto" and the fact that we elected to spend extra on the camera because we're not professional photographers and don't want to be. If fluorescent bulbs were a concept invented last week then I'd be more forgiving, but come on Nikon,  they have been around for a very long time, learn to deal with them already.I'm not sure why the pictures are blurry, but it seems all the fancy steadying tech supposedly in this camera is junk. My 2-year-old $120 camera didn't have any of it and those pictures are much sharper (and properly white-balanced in "auto").Having spent more on this camera than on any camera prior and not being the sort of folks that just have $250 to burn, we were extremely cautious with it. After getting about 300 pictures on it, the shutter button is permanently stuck in the halfway point. If we really smash the button in all directions, it will eventually take a picture, but the effort in doing so results in even blurrier pictures than normal. I was tempted to hold off on the review until I found out how Nikon intends to treat us in the warranty department, but I'm assuming I'll at least have to pay shipping charges, and I'm not certain I want to spend even more money risking the possibility of bad customer service on a product I'm already experiencing serious buyer's remorse over.The battery pack is bittersweet. It lasts a pretty long time compared to the regular AAs from our last camera, but you can pick up AAs anywhere and they're comparatively cheap. For this, you either need to shell out a not insignificant chunk of change on a spare battery or take no pictures while the one you've got charges up. Overall, I think I'd rather have AAs than a battery pack, but I imagine that's personal preference.It is compact. However, so are most of the rocks my daughter picks up, and those are equally functional to this camera, less frustrating to operate, and free.Overall, buying this is an expensive way to get a cheap camera. I'm hoping I can find the box to the camera my daughter broke so we can go back to that brand.

Reviews.Title: Shopped forever and made the wrong choice
Reviews.Author: R. Bush
Reviews.Content: Well I got caught up in the internet hype of "researching" a digital camera before I bought it. Well....... it didn't work. I purchased this for christmas for myself after reading numerous reviews and it is less than I expected. I think I just got too caught up in saving $10 or $20 and it backfired. I don't plan on buying a camera every year or two and I wanted a simple to use, good quality picture taking camera. Don't get me wrong this is a good camera but the problems are the bad quality of the inside pictures and the lack of a good zoom. Even though it has a zoom it is not very useful and the picture quality is grainy and dark. This goes ditto for the inside pictures. Dark and "shadowy" (if thats a word). I am not happy and I would love to return it but I took long testing it and I am stuck. Hope this helps...

Reviews.Title: Feature packed camera -- takes terrible pictures.
Reviews.Author: K. Brennan
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera, to replace a bulky Canon Powershot.  Although it's packed with a lot of great features, I found that at least 90% of all pictures I've taken were blurry.  I primarily use the camera to take pictures of my son -- a toddler who is always on the move.  As such, I've always had to use an action/sports setting to capture him clearly.  The Nikon camera has this setting, but the shutter speed is too slow, and the flash cannot be enabled in this mode.  Every other mode I've tried produces blurry images.  Also, the red-eye reduction and face finder features typically cause my son to shut his eyes for every picture.  I have some lovely shots of him napping, but that's about it.  If you are shooting landscapes or other photos where your subjects will remain still, then this camera is probably fine.  However, I wouldn't recommend it for folks trying to photograph small children or animals.  Additionally, I've found the video mode to be disappointing as well.  The videos have all been surprisingly dim, considering they weren't taken in low-light environments.  Perhaps I received a dud, but I won't be purchasing another Nikon camera.  As always, Amazon's customer service has been excellent, so I'll be applying my refund to a purchase of a newer model Canon.

Reviews.Title: My Pride and Joy
Reviews.Author: K. Nhuc "Kimicle"
Reviews.Content: I was researching a whole bunch of different cameras and in the end it was between this one and the new Cannon SD780.  I ended up buying this one when it went on sale for $130 on Amazon. And so, because it is pink. I absolutely adore the color. After a month of using this camera, I am proud to say it is my pride and joy. I absolutely love it. The picture quality and great and I can't wait to take pictures with it. I love using the different scenes on it. The picture quality and ease of use is great. The only thing that irks me about this camera is that when you want to change the settings on it last minute (we're talking in 15 seconds to get the perfect shot), it can get confusing on how to do it. I don't have the settings memorized yet. But there is no doubt I absolutely adore this camera. My friends are jealous!!

Reviews.Title: Switch to Nikon proves to be the right choice
Reviews.Author: Geo Runner "CMERUN"
Reviews.Content: This camera makes me look like a better photographer than I am! I had been using a Pentax 5si for years. Although the Pentax is still working fine, I figured I would upgrade to a higher megapixel camera, close to the same size. Seems like a good choice. Off/on time is super quick and next-shot time is also very quick. Options are easy to find very user friendly and easy to change as the shot conditions change. 12mp may be more than I need but the image quality is outstanding. I like the idea of the slim size and resident battery. When you travel you will have to carry the A/C charger with you tho. Battery life seems very long and not an issue. All-in-all the Nikon S620 offers all the regular point-and-shoot features as well as advanced setting and scene options.

Reviews.Title: love my Colpix!
Reviews.Author: K. Barrington
Reviews.Content: After researching cameras for 2 weeks, I decided that the Coolpix S620 would best meet my needs.  The default settings for the most part make picture-taking easy.  An added bonus that I was not aware of is the ablilty to hook-up your camera to your TV (mine is a large flat-screened TV) and watch a slide show instantly.  Awesome.  The best price I found was at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: radthernurse
Reviews.Content: The Nikon CoolPix S620 has proven to be a nice little camera for the price. I think like most electronics, quality seems to improve while prices stay down. I like this one much better than the Kodak I bought a few years ago at about the same price. Its smaller and takes great pics. Its also easy to use and figure out the controls even without the instruction book. It also has a nice sized 2.7 in. LCD, which makes viewing the pictures taken, very nice. We took ours on a recent cruise to the Bahamas and got some very nice pics. Overall, very nice little camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: The worst camera i have ever had :(
Reviews.Author: A. talari
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this camera, Lowest quality parts ever used in this cameraThe camera broke down after taking almost 200 pictures, The lens's cover did not open which made the camera uselessI bought this new, apparently advanced, camera to take pictures in this years Christmas when i was in sanfransisco!! I wish i had taken my old camera!! although amazon replaced it quickly after i got back from my holidays how can i get back those moments that i could have taken pictures from, i am really disappointed with the quality of this product, a camera at this price!!

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing pictures.....
Reviews.Author: PAQ "PBRgirl"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a photographer.  I know almost nothing about cameras.  I could never own anything other than a point and shoot.  I just wanted a new camera to take on our cruise because we only have one (it's about 4 years old), and my husband and I do different things on the ship and sometimes on shore.  Sometimes we disagree over who gets to take the camera.  I actually didn't do a lot of research, the Coolpix S620 was the first camera shown on the page, it was a really reasonable price, and it was 12.2 megapixels!!  I didn't even know cameras went that high (like I said, my other camera is 4 years old....I thought 5 megapixels was pretty decent)!!!I thought if it came in and was too difficult to use, I'd just foist it off on my husband and carry the old one.  Man...can I just say I'm glad I carried this camera.  I have the most amazing pictures; and I didn't even delve into all of the fancy settings.  It is so easy to use, and I am very pleased.  I used the "nighttime" setting, the "sunset", "snow/beach", and "dusk/dawn" settings, and the rest of the time it was on "auto."  We did a side by side shot between the his/her cameras for a nighttime picture, and there was no comparison, my shot was clear and bright.  I also have a shot of our ship in port at dusk in Cozumel, the sunset is fading behind the ship and the lights are on all over the ship.  We were showing the photos to a friend and when he saw that picture, he asked what kind of lens and filter I had on my camera.  My response was, "Uhhhh. Huh?"  When I told him it was "just a regular camera", he wanted to look at it.  He didn't believe me that we didn't have some kind of color filter on it to pick up the sunset colors.  Now my husband wants his own.  Me and my bright ideas!!!  LOL

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures Quality is not up to expectations
Reviews.Author: SER "SER"
Reviews.Content: I first obtained my camera in 2010.  Within a year the camera literally came apart.  Several screws that hold the end caps on came loose and fell out.  Just before I sent the camera back for repairs the "Shutter button" broke off the stem.  Much to my surprise it was "Plastic" with the stem being way too thin.  I sent the camera back for repairs to Nikon.  I was accused of "Tampering" with the camera.  Nothing could have been further from the truth.  (I was in Iraq and carried this camera daily with me.)  I did nothing and did nothing more than carry the camera in my pocket in its carrying case.  The repair was one half the price of a new camera.  After getting the camera back it worked beautifully as before.  In the past week the shutter button snapped off once again.  While I must say the overall workings of the camera are fantastic and love the ease of use, and long lasting battery.  I just hate that there are parts of the camera that are sub-standard.  I am not facing the prospect of buying a new camera since my Nikon has broken twice in three years.  Just not sure I'd buy another Nikon with the issues I have had even though the pictures are great from this little camera.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: Jsteed "Jsteed59"
Reviews.Content: I must say i purchase this years ago and to this day i still use the item.  Pros for a check price it was a high mega pixel camera with great zooming capabilities. Con its not a pro camera.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera! And CUTE!
Reviews.Author: Becky & Ciara
Reviews.Content: I'm a 15 year old girl, and I personally love this camera. I like to run around my yard all day and take full advantage of the close up option. Though it's a little hard to focus, most of my pictures turn out great, and the colors are vivid and superb. It's a tough camera, too. I went on Splash Mountain at Disney World with this camera (stupidly) and it survived being submerged in water for about 10 seconds. I wouldn't try to leave it in water any longer than that, however. I just wish that it took the picture right as you pressed the shutter button, rather than the delay some cameras have. Other than that, it's a great camera, and one of my best Christmas gifts. xD

Reviews.Title: Throw it away!
Reviews.Author: Keith Nash
Reviews.Content: The plastic shutter release button fell off after 13 months.  That made it one month out of warranty.I sent it back to Nikon for repairs and when it was returned repaired it cost me $12 more than I paid for the camera.So I suggest if you need any repairs, throw it away and buy a new one, same model or shop.While awaiting the return of my Nikon, I purchased a Samsung ES75 and am pleased with it.I don't know how Nikon can justify their repair price for what I consider a minor fix!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: rosebud
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my husband whose hobby is photography. He has a lot of camera equipment and this camera is a small toy for him. He likes the camera, but doesn't like that the video resolution isn't higher. However, this is available out there, just not on this camera. He is happy with what it can do.

Reviews.Title: very good and reasonable price
Reviews.Author: H. H. A. Saleh
Reviews.Content: Nikon S620 is a very good digital camera and very easy to carry. with 12.2 MP and 4x optical zoom the photos taken is clear and nice. the vibration reduction is really cool and no need to be prof. to take nice and clear photo.better than other braand with the same features such as canon, sony, etc.

Reviews.Title: Decent Point And Shoot
Reviews.Author: AustinInLibby
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent for a point and shoot.My main complaints are that not all of the controls can be manually adjusted.You can only choose ISO sensitivity and exposure compensation- and therefore influence aperture and shutter speed; but you can't actually choose them.This camera does pretty good in low light at ISO100 and with a tripod. I have done lots of night time shots. However, it seems to always choose an aperture that makes bright light sources have rays around them.This camera even does pretty good with a flash but I try not to use one if I can help it.The speed is pretty good and it will burst up to 2fps at 12MP in bright sunlight.  The white balance is not always the best but it does have a setting that allows you to set custom white balance for a scene.  Snow tends to have a blue hue under most white balance settings though, especially at dusk or early morning.The camera's design and construction are good. I have dropped it several times and I almost always carry it in my pants pocket.  All of the exterior case screws have fallen out and the ends are held on with superglue.  It is still completely functional with no issues other than case cosmetics. This camera uses a proprietary USB cable and a battery pack. I like the battery pack because I can charge it and be good for several weeks of casual shooting or for a whole day of filling the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Don't do it
Reviews.Author: N. Rogers
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera based on reviews and because I have a Nikon digital SLR I love. I also wanted something that would go in my pocket.While this camera is extremely portable and the battery seems to last forever, the benefits end there.THIS CAMERA DOES NOT WANT TO FOCUS ON ANYTHING. I often have to put it on macro mode to focus on items as far away as 6 feet instead of items very close, and it often doesn't focus no matter what I do. It just gives me the red box telling me it couldn't focus. Even when I get the green box telling me that it focused, I often upload to the pics to my computer only to find out that they came out blurry.I regret buying this camera as it has ruined a lot of photo moments that I thought I captured but didn't.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Toro819
Reviews.Content: Love the camera-needed an upgrade after I dropped my s-550 in the sand lense side down! Did some research; great point and click camera. Great shot quality, even without flash! After turning it on it has a slight second delay before it takes a picture or goes to play mode but other than that I have no complaints. Love the color, love the pictures, love the sleekness. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Quite Satisfied
Reviews.Author: YAG
Reviews.Content: This is quite a good camera.  My only problem is that it takes too long to capture the image when taking a picture.

Reviews.Title: Bulky and poorly constructed
Reviews.Author: Gypsy Gal
Reviews.Content: Whilst this camera takes fairly nice photos, it's very slow to focus.  I've missed a few key photos while waiting for the camera to be ready to shoot.Additionally, I noticed a few months after I got it that the small screws on both sides of the camera had fallen out.  One day the side panel just fell off.  I have yet to be able to get this fixed but I imagine that a Nikon store should be able to help.For me, the camera is too bulky to carry around in a small purse but it takes good pictures.My 2 cents

Reviews.Title: Great camera when new, deteriorates with time
Reviews.Author: Norberto Perez
Reviews.Content: When I first got this camera is was great. It had really fast load time and it was very easy to use. But after having it for about 6 months the zoom button has started to stick, making it difficult to zoom in to a point where you want to take the picture. If I had known this in the past, I would not have bought the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Xmas gift
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Kent "MJK"
Reviews.Content: This was a great Christmas gift.  Everything has been great.  I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coopix S620
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  Small and easy to use.  Fits in my front pocket well.  Pictures come out fine.  The settings are intuitive.  Don't really need instructions to use.  Have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix  S620
Reviews.Author: A. Haynes
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and has great picture quality. I bought it for my 14 year old and he was able to start taking pictures right away.

Reviews.Title: The Nikon S620 is the very best $129 camera on the market!!!
Reviews.Author: P. Koshel
Reviews.Content: There are smaller digital cameras on the market, some have larger screens and longer telephoto lens, and a few may take sharper pictures.  BUT they all cost 2x to 4x more money.  BUY this camera!

Reviews.Title: A door to the digital world.
Reviews.Author: G. Stewart
Reviews.Content: It is a joy to me to give a Christmas present that keeps on giving.  The old line of "Open me first" comes to mindas this new tool comes to life and the features keep on coming into focus.  So far the only possible point ofpause is the vast array of capabilites that are packed into this camera.  Gone is the "view finder". And the sureness of what you see is what you get gives a whole new thrill to taking pictures again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Graybill
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful. The battery lasts for AGES...I took it on a trip with me in December, used it frequently then, and used it fairly frequently all throughout January, and didn't have to charge it until the first week of February! The pictures are of awesome quality and in general, it's great.

Reviews.Title: The Best Camera, Ever!
Reviews.Author: Julie Roth
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my BF for Xmas.  We both LOVE IT!  It's easy to use, very small and portable and takes AWESOME pictures! I wish I could get myself one at the same great price.

Reviews.Title: Great "little" inexpensive camera.
Reviews.Author: War Eagle "Howard"
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a small, simple to operate, camera that she could carry in her pocketbook. The Nikon Coolpix S620 has filled the bill. The stills are very good and the videos are great. I charged the battery when we got it, near Christmas, and it hasn't required a recharge since. If you need a technical report you'll need to look further but if your're looking for a satisfied consumer, you've found him.

Reviews.Title: great snapshot camera
Reviews.Author: Louis A. Hodson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife's Christmas present. She started to use it as soon as I showed her where the shutter and zoom controls were. This ranks very high on the ease of use factor. She didn't spend hours with the manual before taking excellent pictures. I'm sure there are many professionals rating this camera that find flaws, but for vacation and grandkids pictures that are clear and have great color, this one is hard to beat. As a plus, the replacement battery is less than ten dollars. That's less than the non-rechargable battery for her Minolta 35mm.No disappointment here!

Reviews.Title: Very Handy
Reviews.Author: E.R. "E-Fly"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very handy and seems to be very well made.  The feel of the camera isn't cheap like many other cameras in the same price range.  The picture quality is always great.  Usually we just take pictures on the auto mode but the other manual picture settings have been useful from time to time.  The nightshot feature is very good at illuminating objects when you take low light pictures.  The downside to the nightshot setting is that you have to either hold the camera extremely still or set it on a stable surface or you will get blurry photos.  The screen is very large and makes it much easier to review your photos versus plugging the card into your computer and later seeing that the picture you took is not good.  That being said, the very large screen on the back is very easy to get fingerprints on since it occupies most of the space on the back of the camera.  The start up time is very quick.  Once you hit the "On" button the camera is ready to shoot a picture in less than 5 seconds.  Also, the zoom is very quick as well.The cameras stability feature is very good for leveling out normal hand shaking when taking pictures so on most of the settings (except nightshot) the picture turns out very clear and is rarely blurry.  The buttons are all well place and are very intuitive.  The rotating dial selector on the back of the camera makes it very quick and easy to move through all of the menu settings.  Instead of hitting one button over and over, you can instead rotate the button and more rapidly scroll through the selections on the screen.Overall, this is a fantastic camera for point and shoot applications.  It doesn't have the quality of an SLR camera but still produces great images for the rest of us.  It's size makes it very handy to carry in a pocket or in a purse.  There has been several times that we have wanted/needed the camera while out and about and have been able to just pull it out and snap a picture in seconds.We purchased this camera around christmas time when it was on sale for $149 and couldn't be happier with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Ruger
Reviews.Content: I am still having a hard time getting the camera to focus quickly.  I will say I have not read the manual completely, but just haven't had time.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Review
Reviews.Author: S. Shimasaki
Reviews.Content: There is one feature I can't figure out. When I got the camera and took a couple of pictures, it asked me if I wanted to save the photo. I said, "yes" but when I tried to access my digital card, I could not find my photos.I know the camera has an internal memory that needs to be formatted prior to use but I never formatted the internal memory, so where are my photos? I took two of them and they are not on the digital card. How do I access the internal memory to retrieve the photos?

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Andy Royce
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift but the person wanted more manual control and less automation.  Ended up returning camera for full refund.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix is a good choice
Reviews.Author: Jean W. Satterfield
Reviews.Content: IO think that there are cameras out there that can do any one thing better than th Nikon Cool Pix. But all features put into one package leaves this camera at the top of the heap.

Reviews.Title: Pro Photographer gave this camera as a gift.
Reviews.Author: OZTEX "Pro Photogragher"
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my wife as a gift. She would use my spare DLSR as her camera, but it was just to big for her to carry around.  She loves this camera it is easy to use, compact, takes great pictures and is loaded with useful features.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MaryB
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to replace a not too old Canon I had.  My daughter had gotten a Nikon Coolpix and I was very impressed with it.  I started researching and found a great deal on this one.  I've only had it a short time, but it got a good workout over the holidays. I am extremely pleased with it so far.  It's easy to use and responds quickly.  The picture quality is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Dayana
Reviews.Content: I am still getting use to this camera; This is the first Nikon and features are little different that the canon and minolta I'm used to handling. Picture quality is great, it does take a little getting used to the shooting delay but its not a huge issue--only gets tricky if taking  pics of kids or animals that dont stay still for pics.Now is 7-2010Had a while to play with my camera. Not as happy as i was with my previous casio. Even my canon and minolta were alot better, easier to use, the picture delay seems not like a bog problem until you keep missing great pic because of it. The lay out of the menu and setting is not as user friendly as other cameras I have owned.  Truly I won t get a nikon again

Reviews.Title: An excellent point and shoot digital camera for the money!!
Reviews.Author: Joseph A. Nowak "Prophotoman"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas gift for my brother who wanted a camera with vibration reduction technology, since his hands are at times a little unsteady. I myself am a professional photographer who uses strictly professional equipment.  I am impressed with the photo quality of a camera that costs less than 3% what my DSLR/pro lens combo does (over $5000).  No the images are not pro quality on this camera, HOWEVER, they are as good as what you can get on any 35mm point and shoot camera, and in most cases sharper than 35mm.What separates a point and shoot from a single DSLR body/lens combo that costs $5000 or more?  It's a LOT more than just money!  Shutter response time even on consumer level DSLR's is MUCH quicker than ANY point and shoot.  This is important for a professional who has to capture images NOW!  Timing is critical to the professional, especially sports photographers!  A good DSLR will give you almost instantanious shutter response, roughly about 1/80th of a second! whereas a point and shoot is always over one second.  My pro DSLR will take up to 8 frames per second in RAW 14 bit mode!  No point and shoot at this time can take more than two frames per second, most are less.  And that is in basic (low quality) JPEG mode!  There are many other differences such as lens quality, image sensor size, video noise, buffer size, etc.All that aside, this camera is perfect for taking family photos for prints of 8 x 10 size. The number of pixels a camera sensor has is not nearly as important as most people believe.  A tiny sensor with 12mp will not give as good a photo overall as a point and shoot with a larger 8 mp sensor.  It has to do with video noise and color separation.  The lens on this camera is pretty good.  It does give pretty sharp images up to about 11 x 14 in print size. Bigger than that and you start seeing what's called chromatic aberration in the print. Edges of the image contents appear to be slightly off color or multi-colored (kind of a rainbow effect).Overall, though, this camera's quality cannot be beat for the price!  Also a good choice for your older pre-teen who is showing some interest in photography.  This is a small camera in size, yet takes very good photographs.Joseph NowakNikonian Gold Member.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at great price
Reviews.Author: D. Woods
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend loves this camera and it is great quality expecially for the price.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: Mr. Gato
Reviews.Content: I bought my Nikon S620 Nikon Coolpix S620 12.2MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Rich Pearl) to have a digital camera that would be convenient for me to take everywhere on weekends and vacations. After two months here's my take on it:Pros:- great size, very compact- excellent picture quality w/ natural light- bright screen, no problem seeing it outdoors- intuitive controls- wide angle lens is great for family & party picturesCons:- kids & pets may turn away at shutter release due to the focus-assist light- flash pictures seem a bit overexposed, am trying different settings to compensateI'd definitely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: C. Dunaway "Topher"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  It takes great pictures with a lot of clarity, and the large display is nice for reviewing your photos.  Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: A pearl of a camera
Reviews.Author: William Winkler
Reviews.Content: Great product for the price $129.00. Pearl color very nice looking. Nice size with a well balanced feel .

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S620
Reviews.Author: Joyce Anne Laird "writer"
Reviews.Content: Amazing little camera. Just scratching the surface of all it can do. Fantastic value for the price.Great to have as a "pocket" camera when the big Digital SLR too cumbersome to carry.

Reviews.Title: Perfect portable fab photo taker!
Reviews.Author: D. Tobin "Book lover"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my 10 year old.  I paired it with a $3.99 (Universal Camera Case for Nikon Coolpix L10, L14, L15, S200, S210, S50, S500, S50c, S51, S510, S52, S520, S550, S560, S600, S610, S700, S710, S230, S220, S640, S570 and Many More... ) white leather case, and it has become her favorite present of all time.  Within minutes of reading the quick start manual, my 10 year old had the camera operating like a pro.  We took it on vacation and the photo quality from her camera rivals the quality of my high end SLR when on automatic settings.  I'm not trying to tell you that this $89 camera can replace my $1000 camera, but for quick family shots and everyday pictures, this is terrific.  The zoom is more than adequate.  We love the rechargeable battery pack (charger included), versus our old Kodak that virtually ate disposable batteries, and the ease of downloading the photos with the included cable.  We added a memory card and she can take hundreds of photos.  The sky blue color of the camera body is really lovely, and it is her favorite color.  I'd highly recommend the Nikon Coolpis S620 12.2 MP with 4x optical zoom for your everyday needs.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S620
Reviews.Author: D. Prescott
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 12-yr old for Xmas.  We love it. Easy to use, great pics and video.  Easy to playback on tv too.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix is Cool
Reviews.Author: M. J. Auten
Reviews.Content: Everything about this camera suits my lifestyle as a young person. And it is small enough to carry in my purse so I can catch pictures anytime, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great all around camera
Reviews.Author: Gary Novak
Reviews.Content: Got this as a portable digital camera that could fit inside the pants pocket for my wife to be used when she is traveling with the dog at dog shows. So far this has better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: 100% sure
Reviews.Author: Erich Harry Bake
Reviews.Content: what can i say ? my 2nd nikon camera (this one for my daughter). just excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Product from the house of NIKON
Reviews.Author: R. Singh "RDS"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. I was using sony's W30 earlier, so this was kind of an upgrade for me. Recently I went on trip and there were 2 of my other friends who had a canon sd780 point and shoot, the cameras looked smaller and more compact than this one, but when it came to shooting pictures, this camera outperformed those by far, it has the night landscape mode which shoots amazing photographs in the night - So my friends also became an instant fan of this camera, and it costs way less than those cameras.It has only one downside which I came across, that it does not use a standard mini usb cable, hence u are bound to carry an extra cable along.I would recommend this camera to all those who are confused on buying a point and shoot, this is clearly the best choice.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Janet Thompson
Reviews.Content: This camera has alot of neat features.  It is quick and very easy to use.  Takes great pictures.  I had a Kodak Easy share camera before---this camera out does that one hands down!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Tyler
Reviews.Content: All in all it is a good camera.  The pictures seem a little more fuzzy than our previous camera and red eye is more prevalent but we have not had as much time to play with it and learn all of the features yet.  The software that comes with the camera does remove red eye but then you get a glass eye looking picture.  Still unsure, but right now it is our camera so we are stuck with it, may still use the old camera to take some shots though.

Reviews.Title: Cannot beat this camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Steven Brown "Steven Brown"
Reviews.Content: Great price, picture is great, battery lasts for hundreds of pictures @ 12MP.  I have not had to use my backup battery that I purchased as of yet!  This camera is small, but fits your hand nicely.  Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great point/shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Ian Zoll "Ian"
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty fun. Its smaller then my cell phone (Verizon LG ENV2) so you can pretty much take it anywhere without it being in the way.  All the pre-set modes are nice to play around with.  Its fast and the quality is pretty good for a point shoot camera that fits in your pocket.  Only downside i found so far was when i was at a wedding trying to take pictures of the slow dance in very low light from about 20 feet away.  It just couldnt quite get the focus right, even with them moving rather slow.  I flipped threw a few different modes including auto mode and they came out blurry every time.  So in situations like that, it might not be the best camera for the job.  But for portability, functions and semi-light indoor to outdoor scenes its quite good.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, with so many packed in features!
Reviews.Author: Jo of Sacto
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my husband as a Christmas gift, he is a gadgets freak.  He loved it and continues to point out all the many features he is impressed with as he goes through the manual.  It was a huge hit with great pictures.  One of the many things he most admires is that there is no delay when taking a picture.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S620
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Schreiner
Reviews.Content: I love the camera except one thing.  The auto setting for the ISO tends to wash out the pictures when the flash is used indoors.  I have to go into the menu and change the ISO setting to get it not to wash out my family's faces.  Otherwise, the camera has a great display and it is very small and easy to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Carlos Avila "uknowmehomey"
Reviews.Content: Great camera at an awesome price. Takes great pictures and has a lot of cool features.

Reviews.Title: Compact, light, fantastic pictures
Reviews.Author: Rich W. "Captain Rich"
Reviews.Content: Great camera all around.  Fantastic zoom, perfect pictures in low light.  Only complaints are I wish it had the bigger display that my Nikon s6 had and it's a bit too small for my big fingers.

Reviews.Title: GREAT little camera
Reviews.Author: K. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my grand daughter who is in the Navy in Sasebo, Japan on board a carrier ship.  She was always borrowing a camera to take some lovely pictures and so I said I would get her one and after much investigation I heard only good things about this Coolpix one.  Well, she loves it and I am so happy that she does because she is going to have a baby in June and being that I will be a great grandmother, I want pictures.  It was a great price and shipping was free with the Super Saver Shipping so I am 100% happy right now.  She is learning all the many settings and soon she will have it mastered...thanks Amazon for having such a nice little camera with such great qualities!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Canon camera
Reviews.Author: T. TRAN
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom as Xmas gift. I pick it because of the small size and also because of many possitive comments about it from other customers on here.  However, I have tried it for the first time and took some family pictures.  I used both my small Canon camera and this Nikon new one. Some of the pictures taken by the Coolpix Nikon are blurry with red eyes problem, while other pictures taken by my Canon camera are clear and beautiful. I was a bit disappointed with this Nikon camera.  I have not tried it the second time yet.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Angela F Jacobson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera along with an extra battery.  This camera will not hold a charge and now can not be returned.  I have tried to charge both batteries and neither will hold a charge.  Do not buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: lnel176 "Lnel"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to have a nice camera that would fit in my purse. I have a really great larger one but hardly ever take it because I don't like hauling it around. So Nikon has a great reputation, right? With 12.2 mp this camera should produce awesome pictures...but it doesn't! It has some very impressive pre-sets, the pics all looked blurry and yellow. So I went back to basics and just used the auto setting...still yellow and a lot are still blurry. I didn't spend enough time with it when I first got it and by the time I discovered I hated it, I was past my 30 day return time. I'm stuck with it so I hope I can figure out how to make it work better for me.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with flash picture quality but like the portability
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: I am happy to have a camera that fits in my pocket but I am disappointed in the picture quality, especially with flash. The photos just aren't sharp like my old Canon A610. Maybe I'm missing something--I need to experiment with the settings probably.The best thing is I bought it for half the price it is selling for now!

Reviews.Title: Annoying red light strikes into the eyes
Reviews.Author: V. Choyi
Reviews.Content: Under low light conditions, the camera flashes a sharp red light. This is very annoying and bothersome for the person(s) of whom the picture is being taken. This happens generally under low light.It is not worth buying this camera just for this basic flaw. I can't believe a company like Nikon releases products with such a basic flaw.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and very fast shipping
Reviews.Author: B Dicky
Reviews.Content: I put two day shipping on the camera and it arrived in only one day! That alone made me happy. I have only had the camera for about a day and have only had a few hours to play around with it but so far I have no complaints. There are no problems with it and it was secure in the box it was shipped in. The one thing I haven't done yet is use the Nikon software that came with the camera. I did install it but didn't transfer the picture I took to my PC yet. It had no problems installing on Windows 7 64-bit though.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix S620
Reviews.Author: R. Bernitt
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the purchase. Have yet to explore all of its capabilities but very easy to use and has produced many quality shots.

Reviews.Title: Shipping!!!
Reviews.Author: H. Roach "helen_r"
Reviews.Content: I can't rate the camera yet (I'll add to this later) because the box just arrived, so this review is just for Amazon.  I had it sent Two Day Shipping, and it showed up at my door less than 24 hours later!!!  Wow.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: stkarma
Reviews.Content: I am not impressed with the Nikon Coolpix S620. It does not take pictures worth keeping that are up close or at a distance. It only seems to take good pictures of objects a couple feet away. I am looking for a new camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
Box Contents - Coolpix S620, Li-ion rechargeable battery EN-EL12, Battery Charger, USB Cable, Audio/Video Cable, Strap, Softwares
12.2 MP (up to 4000 x 3000) CCD for high resolution, detailed images and large prints. Including Widescreen 1920 x 1080 (16 - 9).
4x Optical Zoom (35mm format - 28-112mm) - NIKKOR optics provide exceptional images.
Incredible, Bright 2.7-inch High Resolution LCD makes it easy to compose and share your pictures with friends and family.
4 Way VR Image Stabilization - Nikon's Optical VR Image Stabilization compensates for the effects of camera shake by moving the image sensor.
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix S620 12.2MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Rich Pearl)
